arts.ttl: RB Leipzig fight back to frustrate Bayer Leverkusen one more time
arts.sum: With Florian Wirtz running the show in Saxony, Bayer Leverkusen raced into a two-goal lead against Leipzig but the defending Bundesliga champions failed to hold on, as David Raum's deflected free kick and an Edmond Tapsoba own-goal had the home fans celebrating another comeback against the Werkself. Alonso's men sunsequently doubled their lead in the 36th minute through García, who calmly slotted home after another piece of magic from Wirtz.

arts.ttl: PLAYER RATINGS | RB Leipzig put a dent in Bayer Leverkusen’s title defence
arts.sum: RB Leipzig put a dent in Bayer Leverkusen’s title defence to secure a draw after coming from 2-0 down, meaning Xabi Alonso’s side fall six points behind leaders Bayern Munich.…

arts.ttl: Tottenham's Timo Werner 'in talks' over shock January move after RB Leipzig recall decision
arts.sum: Misfiring Tottenham Hotspur attacker Timo Werner - on loan from RB Leipzig - is reportedly being eyed up by MLS outfit New York Red Bulls.

arts.ttl: Bayer Leverkusen in talks to sign AS Roma’s Mario Hermoso
arts.sum: According to Fabrizio Romano, Bayer Leverkusen are closing in on the signing of AS Roma centre-back Mario Hermoso. It had previously been reported that Die Werkself were looking to conduct…

arts.ttl: Transfer news and rumours: Man United forward leaves on loan, Andre Silva in advanced talks over West Ham move
arts.sum: Sports Mole rounds up the latest transfer news and rumours, including Ethan Wheatley to Walsall, Andre Silva to West Ham United and an update on Beto's future at Everton.

arts.ttl: Bayer Leverkusen exploring deal to sign Aston Villa’s Emiliano Buendia on loan
arts.sum: Sky Germany reports that Bayer Leverkusen are exploring a deal to sign Aston Villa’s Emiliano Buendia on loan for the rest of the season. It is well known that Leverkusen is…

arts.ttl: Arsenal, Chelsea or Man Utd? Benjamin Sesko has already picked his next club
arts.sum: RB Leipzig striker Benjamin Sesko is one of the most eligible players on the transfer market, but the Slovenia international already knows what club he wants to play for when he leaves the Bundesliga side. “Last summer when the project was pitched from Arsenal, Chelsea and Man United, Sesko picked Arsenal and then made a secondary choice of whether it was now or to stay at Leipzig,” football transfer news expert Ben Jacobs told Inside Gooners.

arts.ttl: Saturday's Bundesliga predictions including RB Leipzig vs. Bayer Leverkusen
